lead_paragraph: The ruling military junta has begun a voluntary program calling for government employees to exercise once a week during working hours.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham reported from Bangkok, and Mike Ives from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By POYPITI AMATATHAM and MIKE IVES

headline.main: Thailand’s Civil Servants Urged to Take a Break to Break a Sweat

snippet: The ruling military junta has begun a voluntary program calling for government employees to exercise once a week during working hours....
abstract: Thailand has begun implementation of voluntary program, created by country's prime minister, Gen Prayuth Chan-ocha, in which civil servants can attend exercise sessions during working hours; program is meant to address widespread physical idleness among country's youth and older citizens.
